attributes.action: Implement a 20mph speed limit in the hamlet of Brill, Constantine.
attributes.additional_details: A reaction in the speed limit will significantly reduce the risk of accidents involving motor vehicles and pedestrians when using the public roads through Brill. A speed reduction to 20mph would potenially reduce the severity of injury should accounts still occur.  Vehicles travelling at 20mph emit less emissions than those travelling up to 40mph. Brill is currently discriminated against as it does not receive the protection afforded to similar areas of population in the area.
attributes.background: The roads that run through Brill are narrow, winding, unlit at night and have few pavements to protect pedestrians.  The road have tight bends limiting visibility for vehicles and pedestrians. Children living in Brill who walk to the Primary School in Constantine are not protected by pavements.

rejection.details:
Setting speed limits on local roads is the responsibility of the local council. You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
 
You could also ask your MP to take action on your concerns about this issue, including by asking them to present a public (paper) petition about this.
 
You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP
 
And you can find out how to ask your MP to present a public (paper) petition here: https://www.parliament.uk/get-involved/sign-a-petition/paper-petitions/
